intro: Tapura mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican tapurá, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, adapted to reduce water loss. The flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a cluster, and bloom in the spring and early summer.
